page.title: 07Skidby Post Office.
page.content: Mr Clapham's shop is an old building and he has had it since 1959. The Post Office is also a shop which Mrs Clapham looks after and they sell some medical goods, sweets and pet food. Mr Clapham is also the village milkman and he delivers milk, lemonade, butter, fruit juices and cordials. He gets his milk from Northern Dairies. The milk is delivered to his shop the night before and kept in a big fridge overnight. Mr. Clapham gets up at 5am and sets of on his round at 6am. He finishes his round at lunchtime. Mr and Mrs Clapham have nine dogs; one is a Red Setter and the rest are Border Terriers which he breeds and shows. They also have a pony which is kept in a field near their house.
